Posts.Content: mrkadb wrote: Hi ladies... well, I must have really misunderstood the doctor last time! I thought I was having a needle done today.. but when I went in, she re-ultrasounded the node.. it was still there.. and still large.  So she said she'd rather do a core biopsy so she could actually take chunks of it out.. yuck :) Actually , I must say, she did an amazing job.. she did the numbing just right - I barely even felt any of the numbing shots... and did not feel any of the biopsy process! Did not feel the incision, or the removal of the node parts.  She took two node parts out.. she used the ultrasound the whole time.  After my second chunk was out, she said she saw one more spot she wanted to take out - I said go for it.  So she took that out too.  It's off to the labs.. I leave Friday for FL, and she was so nice saying she'd get the results in by then so I could come to an appointment that morning to go over the results with her. - yay for a great understand and proactive breast doctor! Anyway, I'm sure it's nothing.. but.. I'm glad she's being so proactive! I must say, I'm sore as HECK now though.... the process was not painful.. but.. right about now, I think I'd rather be recovering from childbirth than have this soreness! ugh. HOpe you all are well - thanks for listening to me through this process! I impatiently await my results on Friday..... Molly Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Had my Biopsy today mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2008 12:26AM mrkadb wrote: Oh, and she put some sort of marker or something in there after? Is that so she can see where she biopsied later on? Just curious...
Posts.Title: Had my Biopsy today mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2008 01:13AM mrkadb wrote: Oh, and also -- the doc. asked me today if it was really important to me to keep nursing Anna for the remainder of her first year (she's 7 mos)... or if I'd be ok if I had to give it up earlier.... I was curious at that question... strange.
Posts.Title: Had my Biopsy today mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2008 12:23AM mrkadb wrote: Hi there - no she didnt' say much.  She said maybe that's totally unrelated - like due to my horomones and cycle or something gearing back up after breastfeeding.. so who knows... She said she'll know more after my results come in on Friday morning.   Oh, and I don't mind you asking! If I post it here, I kinda consider it's "askable" :) Thanks again for your response.. I will be anxiously awaiting Friday!  I know I must sound crazy when I talk about the process and seeing the jar was kinda "cool".. but.. I figure why worry when I don't know what's going on yet...and I've always been fascinated about stuff like that... I guess that comes from my family (grandpa was an MD/PHD who worked in the lab on vaccines :)) Anyway, thanks again and I will be sure to post results when they come in Friday -- hopefully, B9! At least, that's what I'm praying for!
Posts.Title: Had my Biopsy today mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: mrkadb wrote: I had a bothersome feeling on the side of my left breast (near where it meets the armpit)... I let it go for over 2 weeks thinking for sure it would turn painful, and be another onset of mastitis or a blocked duct - both of which I've had before (I'm nursing my daughter who is now 6 mos old)....I went to my OB when it didn't resolve or turn painful like an infection - she immediately prescribed meds in case it was an infection stuck in the lymph node so that illness can be ruled out... and also sent me to a breast specialist just to be on the safe side.  More than half way through my meds, I went to see the breast specialist for an u/s of my left breast on the side near armpit because I've still been having radiating pain in it at random that is in my breast and my left shoulder and can feel something "funny" in there.... it's hard to explain... at the ultrasound, they said my lymph node over there is really large and bigger than they would like..over 2cm.... I'm now almost finished with the strong antibiotics (been taking them 4 times per day just in case it was an infection), but so far, the node is not getting smaller..I'd think it would if it were an infection? Every other time I've been on diff. meds for infections (ie: mastitis), I can feel the difference within 24-48 hours.... I've also found a lump/mass just below my left breast now on my upper rib cage..probably about 2 finger widths below the bottom of that breast.  I'll have them look at this at my follow up on June 5th, but now I'm confused~!  Could any of this be anything serious or could it still be an infection and maybe in need of another round or even stronger meds?  It's just so strange because I've had clogged ducts and mastitis many times before with nursing my last daughter and my current infant, and.. this is definitely not a similar experience.. it's different and it's not really painful at all. (neither of the masses are painful). The only pain I do have is sometimes in that left breast I have pain throughout it (not like milk let down.etc.) that goes into my shoulder... also, it sounds crazy.. but, my bones have been hurting me lately too (specifically, legs, hips, back..etc.)...not muscle pain, but almost like my bones ache or something.. ugh!  Oh, and I have no direct family history - only 2 cousins.. but no mom/grandma..etc.  Any insight would be great ! Thanks for listening! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Any info out there on enlarged nodes? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 19, 2008 09:34AM mrkadb wrote: Just bumping to see if anyone out there had any info. or similar stories to share. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Any info out there on enlarged nodes? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 19, 2008 05:05PM mrkadb wrote: Yea... my feeling is since the antibiotics haven't touched it... and although the size an dlocation worries the docs. they dont' feel it's "bad" then probably it is a virus... I'll follow up
Posts.Title: Any info out there on enlarged nodes? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 10:04AM mrkadb wrote: yea who knows.... I mean... you know how it goes! Only 1-3 of the symptoms could actually be related.... and the others just "on the side" .. or related to something 'normal' going on, ya know? My MAIN ones are the enlarged lymph node in my left breast and that weird mass below the left breast on my upper rib..... the only other one out of that list that regularly bothers me is the ache in my left boob/numbness in my left hand..... the shortness of breath and other aches I honestly think are due more to my anxiety about the whole situation! :) Ugh... don't ya just love waiting.....
Posts.Title: Anyone ever heard of Tubucular Mastitis? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 10:25AM mrkadb wrote: Yea... well, 3 kids 3 and under is serving both purposes - ie: they are a good busy distraction.. but.. of course they make me worry too :) The numbness isn't prominent... just started to notice it these last few days actually.... maybe my enlarged node is pushing on something since it's on the left side of the breast/armpit... that could be it.. esp. since I can still feel it and the meds haven't shrunk it. I'm glad I found this board though - at least I can put my ramblings down so people in real life don't think I'm nuts or a crazy person for sifting through every possibility! It prob. is nothing.. but... I'm the kind of person who just has to sift through it ALL so that no matter what, I'm cool with the outcome and can just go down whatever path that it requires..etc.
Posts.Title: Anyone ever heard of Tubucular Mastitis? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 04:33AM mrkadb wrote: I had an ultrasound done last week at a breast care center (breast doc. )...... she said my lymph node was 2cm and I have to come back June 5th after my meds for a follow up..... she said she didn't see much that was "suspicious," but that the size was suspicious... how's that for clarity! :) So should I request another u/s at my June 5th appt?  Ugh, this is so annoying...... My worry is "amplified" because I have 3 daughters - 3, almost 2, and 6 months old.....)
Posts.Title: Can bc be in an enlarged node without a seperate mass/lump? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 04:35AM mrkadb wrote: Oh, also, can an enlarged lymph node on its own be "sick?"... or does there need to be a seperate lump/mass..etc.. to be worrisome?  I realize nodes can enlarge due to infections (I had strep alot as a little kid and I remember my throat nodes)... but, this is just staying around.. ugh
Posts.Title: Can bc be in an enlarged node without a seperate mass/lump? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 09:37AM mrkadb wrote: Yea, as I said in the other one, I'm thinking now maybe since the antibiotics havne't touched it, and since I'm "low risk" for bc's, then maybe it is a virus - mimicking other problems and not reacting to meds.... so I'll definitely ask them about this at my June 5th appt.  That may be why even with the meds I'm still having aching now in my left breast into my shoulder blade... prob because a virus wont' react to the medication. Sorry if I just rambled - I'm stressed, and, nursing and typing :) Molly
Posts.Title: Can bc be in an enlarged node without a seperate mass/lump? mrkadb mrkadb

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 09:38AM mrkadb wrote: Yes, the worry can be stressful - and I'm sure that's what most of my anxiety is.  I just do worry because I've  been SO lucky my whole life so far - with close calls here and there, with 3 beautiful children, NO problem pregnancies.. a brother who served multiple times in dangerous situations in Iraq and returned safely..etc... I just keep thinking I guess my "number's up" at some point with the luck factor!! Esp. with my 3 little ones - I worry for me mostly for them  if ya know what I mean :)

I let it go for over 2 weeks thinking for sure it would turn painful, and be another onset of mastitis or a blocked duct - both of which I've had before (I'm nursing my daughter who is now 6 mos old)....I went to my OB when it didn't resolve or turn painful like an infection - she immediately prescribed meds in case it was an infection stuck in the lymph node so that illness can be ruled out... and also sent me to a breast specialist just to be on the safe side.  More than half way through my meds, I went to see the breast specialist for an u/s of my left breast on the side near armpit because I've still been having radiating pain in it at random that is in my breast and my left shoulder and can feel something "funny" in there.... it's hard to explain... at the ultrasound, they said my lymph node over there is really large and bigger than they would like..over 2cm.... I'm now almost finished with the strong antibiotics (been taking them 4 times per day just in case it was an infection), but so far, the node is not getting smaller..I'd think it would if it were an infection? Every other time I've been on diff. meds for infections (ie: mastitis), I can feel the difference within 24-48 hours.... I've also found a lump/mass just below my left breast now on my upper rib cage..probably about 2 finger widths below the bottom of that breast.  I'll have them look at this at my follow up on June 5th, but now I'm confused~!  Could any of this be anything serious or could it still be an infection and maybe in need of another round or even stronger meds?  It's just so strange because I've had clogged ducts and mastitis many times before with nursing my last daughter and my current infant, and.. this is definitely not a similar experience.. it's different and it's not really painful at all. (neither of the masses are painful). The only pain I do have is sometimes in that left breast I have pain throughout it (not like milk let down.etc.) that goes into my shoulder... also, it sounds crazy.. but, my bones have been hurting me lately too (specifically, legs, hips, back..etc.)...not muscle pain, but almost like my bones ache or something.. ugh!  What is the incidence or possibility that it has something to do with Tubucular Mastitis??? Has anyone even heard of this? It's non-cancerous..... but my symptoms seem to mimic it..... I have the enlarged node...achiness in that side up through my shoulder blade.... I have that seperate mass directly below that breast on my upper rib.... I have aches.... and I'm in the "higher" risk factor group - reproductive age 21 - 30, lactating, and had a history of mastitis (had it 3 times).... I was just reading about this - and, while I'm not in to self diagnosis, I just thought it was very interesting how similar it sounded to me and what I'm going through right now. Thoughts? Or has anyone even heard of this?  Maybe this also explains why my antibiotics I've been on aren't really touching any of my symptoms? Thanks so much! Log in to post a reply
